The article discusses various approaches to grammar induction, including probabilistic context-free grammars (PCFGs) and compound PCFGs. PCFGs are grammars with rule probabilities that are specified by a probabilistic grammar. Compound PCFGs are a type of PCFG that use a compound probability distribution to model the generative process. The article states that the compound PCFG approach is able to induce linguistically meaningful grammars by optimizing log likelihood, and that this can be done through a collapsed approach using amortized inference
